jobs.title: Senior AI Engineer, Inference
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

We’re looking for a Senior AI Engineer to join our Inference Team, where you’ll lead the design and development of our Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) infrastructure. In this role, you will work closely with ML engineers, research scientists, and product teams to power both web search and API-based experiences for millions of users with fast, accurate, and context-aware responses. 

You will architect scalable systems that combine LLMs and vector retrieval, optimizing for relevance, recall, latency, and cost. This is a high-impact role focused on AI/ML inference, retrieval performance, and significant ownership in both technical decision-making and long-term architecture. 

  

Responsibilities

  • Design, build and scale a production-grade inference stack for RAG-based applications. 

  • Develop efficient retrieval pipelines using OpenSearch or similar vector databases, with a focus on high recall and response relevance. 

  • Optimize performance and latency for both real-time and batch queries. 

  • Identify and address bottlenecks in the inference stack to improve response times and system efficiency. 

  • Ensure high reliability, observability, and monitoring of deployed systems. 

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate LLMs and retrieval components into user-facing applications. 

  • Evaluate and integrate modern RAG frameworks and tools to accelerate development. 

  • Guide architectural decisions, mentor team members, and uphold engineering excellence. 

  

Qualifications

  • Masters or PhD degree in AI or related field, or equivalent practical experience. 

  • 8+ years of experience in software engineering, with a focus on AI/ML systems or distributed systems. 

  • Hands-on experience building and deploying retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems. 

  • Deep knowledge of OpenSearch, Elasticsearch, or similar search engines. 

  • Strong coding skills in Python and/or other backend languages (e.g., Rust, Java). 

  • Experience with vector search, embedding pipelines, and dense retrieval techniques. 

  • Proven ability to optimize inference stacks for latency, reliability, and scalability. 

  • Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and debugging skills. 

  • Strong sense of ownership, ability to work independently, and a self-starter mindset in fast-paced environments. 

  • Passion for building impactful technology aligned with our mission. 

  

Preferred Qualifications 

  • Experience with frameworks like LlamaIndex or LangChain. 

  • Familiarity with vector databases such as Pinecone, Qdrant, or FAISS. 

  • Exposure to LLM fine-tuning, semantic search, embeddings, and prompt engineering. 

  • Previous work on systems handling millions of users or queries per day. 

  • Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes). 



Work Environment

Location: This position is Onsite. This role is based at our Bellevue WA (or Pasadena, CA) office location, and employees are expected to work on-site during regular business hours. 

  

Compensation

The compensation for this position will be competitive and commensurate with experience. The estimated salary range for this role is 180,000 - 230,000 USD. 

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to work at the forefront of AI technology 

  • Collaborative and innovative work environment 

  • Competitive salary and benefits package 

  • Professional development and growth opportunities 

  • Chance to make a significant impact on the company's success 

 

Equal Employment Opportunity

  • ProRata is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.  

   

California Specific Notices

  • At-Will Employment: Employment at ProrataAI is at-will. This means that either the employee or the employer may terminate employment at any time, with or without cause or prior notice. 

  • Salary Disclosure: In compliance with California law, salary information is provided to ensure transparency and fairness. 

  • California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA): ProrataAI complies with the CCPA. Personal information collected during the recruitment process will be used for employment purposes only.  

*This open position is not eligible for Company sponsorship of a visa that would require a new H-1B visa petition that is subject to the $100,000 payment requirement announced in the Presidential Proclamation titled “Restriction on Entry of Certain Nonimmigrant Workers,” dated September 19, 2025 (or any extensions or modifications of the Proclamation).

In this role, you will work closely with ML engineers, research scientists, and product teams to power both web search and API-based experiences for millions of users with fast, accurate, and context-aware responses.

Work Environment

Location: This position is Onsite. This role is based at our Bellevue WA (or Pasadena, CA) office location, and employees are expected to work on-site during regular business hours. 

  

Compensation

The compensation for this position will be competitive and commensurate with experience. The estimated salary range for this role is 180,000 - 230,000 USD. 

What We Offer

 - Opportunity to work at the forefront of AI technology 

 - Collaborative and innovative work environment 

 - Competitive salary and benefits package 

 - Professional development and growth opportunities 

 - Chance to make a significant impact on the company's success 

 

Equal Employment Opportunity

 - ProRata is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.  

   

California Specific Notices

 - At-Will Employment: Employment at ProrataAI is at-will. This means that either the employee or the employer may terminate employment at any time, with or without cause or prior notice. 

 - Salary Disclosure: In compliance with California law, salary information is provided to ensure transparency and fairness. 

 - California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA): ProrataAI complies with the CCPA. Personal information collected during the recruitment process will be used for employment purposes only.  

*This open position is not eligible for Company sponsorship of a visa that would require a new H-1B visa petition that is subject to the $100,000 payment requirement announced in the Presidential Proclamation titled “Restriction on Entry of Certain Nonimmigrant Workers,” dated September 19, 2025 (or any extensions or modifications of the Proclamation).

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer, Attribution
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

We are seeking a talented engineering lead as part of the AI Research & Attribution Engineering Team. In this role, you will be in the heart of our mission and responsible for helping to build out our ProRata Attribution products. Specifically, you will be working on large scale content understanding, distributed attribution serving, knowledge systems, agentic backend work, analytics and reporting. If you are passionate about solving hard problems, making a difference, and creating a fairer AI ecosystem, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities

  • Work cross functionally to design and build our ProRata Attribution system & products

  • Partner with other engineering and frontend teams on user management, APIs and service optimization

  • Ensure the content processing, indexing and attribution infrastructure is designed and implemented for robustness, scalability and automation

  • Build out workflow and agentic backend to support new and innovative workflows

  • Collaborate with Revenue and Product Delivery teams to contribute to new use cases for solving problems for customers and clients

  • Participate in IP creation, such as patenting, case studies, white papers and research papers as determined by business needs

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field

  • Extensive experience building large-scale systems for search, NLP/ML areas.

  • 10+ years of commercial software experience

  • Proficiency in programming languages commonly used in AI development (e.g., Python, Java, C++, Rust)

  • Experience building large scale distributed systems / Cloud native

  • Experience building systems with high availability and low latency

  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills

  • Strong communication and leadership abilities to guide teams and collaborate with stakeholders

  • Passion for our mission at ProRata

Additional Qualifications

  • Experience with GenAI especially LLMs

  • Experience with Prompt engineering

  • Experience with GPU inference, Inference software stack CUDA/ROCm

  • Experience in Graph Databases is a plus

  • Startup company experience

Work Environment

Location: This position is Onsite. This role is based at our Bellevue, WA office location, and employees are expected to work on-site during regular business hours.

Compensation

The compensation for this position will be competitive and commensurate with experience. The estimated salary range for this role is 200,000 - 280,000 USD.

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to work at the forefront of AI technology 

  • Collaborative and innovative work environment 

  • Competitive salary and benefits package 

  • Professional development and growth opportunities 

  • Chance to make a significant impact on the company's success 

 

Equal Employment Opportunity

  • ProRata is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.  

   

California Specific Notices

  • At-Will Employment: Employment at ProrataAI is at-will. This means that either the employee or the employer may terminate employment at any time, with or without cause or prior notice. 

  • Salary Disclosure: In compliance with California law, salary information is provided to ensure transparency and fairness. 

  • California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA): ProrataAI complies with the CCPA. Personal information collected during the recruitment process will be used for employment purposes only.  

*This open position is not eligible for Company sponsorship of a visa that would require a new H-1B visa petition that is subject to the $100,000 payment requirement announced in the Presidential Proclamation titled “Restriction on Entry of Certain Nonimmigrant Workers,” dated September 19, 2025 (or any extensions or modifications of the Proclamation).

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, AdTech
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role

We are seeking talented Senior Software Engineers to join us as part of our team! In this role, you will be in the heart of our mission and responsible for helping to build out our products (ProRata Ads, Gist.ai, and more). You will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality software. If you are passionate about solving hard problems, making a difference, and creating a fairer digital ecosystem, we want to hear from you!  
 

This is an in-office role at our location in Bellevue, WA. 
 

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with business leaders and other stakeholders to define software requirements and deliver solutions that meet our business needs

  • Design scalable, reliable, and secure software applications & infrastructure

  • Support the team's technical decision-making, code reviews, and build best practices for ProRata Ads

  • Optimize existing code to improve performance, reliability, and scalability.
     

Qualifications

  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field or equivalent practical experience

  • 4+ years of professional software development experience

  • Strong communication and analytics skills

  • Strong understanding of software architecture, design patterns, and best practices

  • Strong proficiency in programming languages commonly used in AI development (e.g., Python, Java, C++, Rust) 

  • Experience with unit & integration testing in pytest; jest, SQL (Postgres); indexes; Redis or other nosql / cache; version control / Git

  • Passion for ProRata's mission

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with AdTech and/or LLMs

Work Environment

Location: This position is Onsite. This role is based at our Bellevue, WA office location, and employees are expected to work on-site during regular business hours. 

  

Compensation

The compensation for this position will be competitive and commensurate with experience. The estimated salary range for this role is 160,000 -200,000 USD. 

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to work at the forefront of AI technology 

  • Collaborative and innovative work environment 

  • Competitive salary and benefits package 

  • Professional development and growth opportunities 

  • Chance to make a significant impact on the company's success 

 

Equal Employment Opportunity

  • ProRata is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.  

   

California Specific Notices

  • At-Will Employment: Employment at ProrataAI is at-will. This means that either the employee or the employer may terminate employment at any time, with or without cause or prior notice. 

  • Salary Disclosure: In compliance with California law, salary information is provided to ensure transparency and fairness. 

  • California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA): ProrataAI complies with the CCPA. Personal information collected during the recruitment process will be used for employment purposes only.  

*This open position is not eligible for Company sponsorship of a visa that would require a new H-1B visa petition that is subject to the $100,000 payment requirement announced in the Presidential Proclamation titled “Restriction on Entry of Certain Nonimmigrant Workers,” dated September 19, 2025 (or any extensions or modifications of the Proclamation).

jobs.title: Director of Sales
jobs.descriptionHtml:
ProRata is pioneering AI-native advertising through its Gist Ads network, delivering contextual, generative AI-powered ad formats across AI search engines, chatbots, and premium publishers. We partner with leading brands and agencies to create incremental, brand-safe, high-intent advertising opportunities in the next major media channel.

Role

We are seeking a seasoned, entrepreneurial Director of Sales to evangelize and sell media opportunities in this exciting new channel. In this digital media sales role you will be focused on educating the market, prospecting new clients, and driving direct revenue from brands and agencies. The ideal candidate has a deep rolodex of agency and brand relationships, a proven ability to hunt and close new business, and the confidence to champion a new media category in the marketplace.

Responsibilities

  • Prospect, pitch, and close new business with brand and agency partners.

  • Own the full sales cycle (pipeline development, solution selling, negotiation, and close).

  • Evangelize the GenAI media category, clearly articulating ProRata’s differentiation and value to marketers.

  • Represent ProRata at client meetings, industry events, and thought leadership forums to grow awareness.

  • Partner with product, marketing, and operations teams to ensure client success, renewals, and upsell.

  • Deliver market feedback to influence product roadmap, ad formats, and sales enablement.

  • Consistently exceed revenue targets with a focus on scalable, repeatable business growth.

Qualifications

  • 7-10 years in digital media or AdTech sales with a record of exceeding targets at emerging platforms or high-growth startups.

  • Proven success selling new or category-defining media formats (e.g., programmatic, CTV, native, performance).

  • Deep relationships with decision-makers at agencies and brands; strength in performance and innovation budgets is a plus.

  • Skilled at educating clients and building confidence in non-traditional solutions.

  • Startup mindset: thrives in fast-paced, ambiguous environments; adaptable, resourceful, and comfortable with change.

  • Strong communicator and consultative seller with excellent presentation skills.

  • Passion for AI, media innovation, and performance-driven marketing.

Work Environment

  • Remote in CA, CO, IL, MD, NY, TX, or WA (NYC preferred). Employees are expected to have a reliable internet connection and a suitable home office setup. Occasional travel (25%) to the office or to customers may be required.

Compensation

  • The compensation for this position will be competitive and commensurate with experience. It has a cash compensation of $300,000 -350,000 OTE (50/50 base variable) + equity.

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to work at the forefront of AI technology 

  • Collaborative and innovative work environment 

  • Competitive salary and benefits package 

  • Professional development and growth opportunities 

  • Chance to make a significant impact on the company's success 

 

Equal Employment Opportunity

  • ProRata is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.  

   

California Specific Notices

  • At-Will Employment: Employment at ProrataAI is at-will. This means that either the employee or the employer may terminate employment at any time, with or without cause or prior notice. 

  • Salary Disclosure: In compliance with California law, salary information is provided to ensure transparency and fairness. 

  • California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA): ProrataAI complies with the CCPA. Personal information collected during the recruitment process will be used for employment purposes only.  

*This open position is not eligible for Company sponsorship of a visa that would require a new H-1B visa petition that is subject to the $100,000 payment requirement announced in the Presidential Proclamation titled “Restriction on Entry of Certain Nonimmigrant Workers,” dated September 19, 2025 (or any extensions or modifications of the Proclamation).

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Full Stack
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role
We’re looking for a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer to join our fast-growing team at ProRata, where we’re striving to create a fairer digital ecosystem. You’ll play a key role in the development of both the frontend and backend systems that power the Gist Console, a core platform in our partner experience. You’ll collaborate across engineering, product, and design to build scalable, high-quality features with a focus on performance, usability, and impact. If you thrive on solving challenging problems and are excited about creating a fairer digital ecosystem, we’d want to hear from you!

This is an in-office role at our location in Bellevue, WA.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain scalable and secure web applications using Next.js, TypeScript, SQL, and CSS

  • Develop and maintain integrations with backend services and APIs

  • Lead and participate in architectural decisions, code reviews, and technical discussions

  • Partner with designers to bring UI/UX designs to life with high fidelity and performance

  • Continuously optimize frontend and backend performance for speed, scalability, and reliability

  • Own features end-to-end (from concept to deployment and support)

  • Contribute to improving engineering best practices and team processes

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of professional software engineering experience

  • Strong proficiency in TypeScript, React, Node.js, Next.js, SQL, and modern CSS

  • Solid understanding of frontend architecture and state management

  • Experience with databases like PostgreSQL, MongoDB, or OpenSearch

  • Familiarity with REST APIs and backend service development

  • Comfort diagnosing performance bottlenecks and debugging complex issues

  • Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment

  • Strong understanding of UX principles, accessibility, and responsive design

  • Ability to translate designs from tools like Figma into clean, production-ready code

  • Excellent communication and analytical skills

  • Passion for ProRata’s mission

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with Python and training AI models for LLMs

  • Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and developer tooling

Work Environment

Location: This position is Onsite. This role is based at our Bellevue, WA office location, and employees are expected to work on-site during regular business hours.

Compensation

The compensation for this position will be competitive and commensurate with experience. The estimated salary range for this role is 160,000 -200,000 USD.

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to work at the forefront of AI technology 

  • Collaborative and innovative work environment 

  • Competitive salary and benefits package 

  • Professional development and growth opportunities 

  • Chance to make a significant impact on the company's success 

 

Equal Employment Opportunity

  • ProRata is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs.  

   

California Specific Notices

  • At-Will Employment: Employment at ProrataAI is at-will. This means that either the employee or the employer may terminate employment at any time, with or without cause or prior notice. 

  • Salary Disclosure: In compliance with California law, salary information is provided to ensure transparency and fairness. 

  • California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA): ProrataAI complies with the CCPA. Personal information collected during the recruitment process will be used for employment purposes only.  

*This open position is not eligible for Company sponsorship of a visa that would require a new H-1B visa petition that is subject to the $100,000 payment requirement announced in the Presidential Proclamation titled “Restriction on Entry of Certain Nonimmigrant Workers,” dated September 19, 2025 (or any extensions or modifications of the Proclamation).
